title: The Lazarus Ledger
premise: A forensic archivist, hired to digitize the records of a powerful philanthropic foundation, discovers a pattern of 'donors' who were officially declared dead years before their generous contributions. Her investigation uncovers a chilling exchange: immense wealth for a complete societal erasure and a new identity, offered only to those hiding the world's most terrible secrets.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a meticulous and morally rigid records specialist with a traumatic gap in her own childhood memory.
conflict: Elara must expose the foundation's 'resurrection' service for elite criminals and monsters before she is identified and becomes a target herself, all while grappling with the possibility that her own missing past may be connected to their ledger.
setting: Present-day, alternating between the sleek, silent archives of the Olympus Foundation in Zurich and the gritty underbelly of global tax havens.
tone: Paranoid, intellectually suspenseful, and coldly clinical, escalating into a desperate race for truth against an enemy that can make anyone disappear.
